Posts.Content: Mar 13, 2013 01:08PM Moviemaniac wrote: Hello to all my MUCH braver Warrior sisters!   I got the same advice from 2nd Onc....no tx needed.  I don't know how to feel about it, b/c it shows that no matter where you are with this B**ch, you are NEVER done.   I just hope with time that my thoughts don't automatically wander to the possibility that *it* could come back.....seems so trivial when compared to what some of you are going through.  First Onc had me BRCA tested due to high incidence of Prostate, Colon, and misc. cancers (not to mention my mom's breast cancer) in my family.  I feel like a genetic cesspool..... If it comes back positive, he wants my ovaries out pronto.  Yay. (And my four daughters will have to be tested-all of them are over 20.)  Got my official Path. report yesterday, and the Onc's office had accidentally given me two pages of someone else's Dr.'s surgical report.....I really didn't realize that it had nothing to do with my info, until I got to her age, and realized she was half as old as I am, with a terrible prognosis.....I was so upset for her I cried all afternoon.  ( I shredded the info)  Feeling pretty bummed out right now. And I have no reason to feel like this, all things considered!   So happy for you ladies that are nearing the end of your Chemo tx- that is wonderful news! I think I have caught the cyberbug too.  Feel very tired and run down.  Def. not getting enough sleep-right now I have a few disolvable sutures that haven't disolved, and have worked their way to the surface, or just under it, on my abdominal incision.  Every time I change positions at night, the d**n things wake me up! So glad I have a place I can be where other women know how I feel.....love you all!  XO Namaste and God Bless - Jackie

Posts.Content: Jun 4, 2013 12:27PM - edited Jun 4, 2013 12:28PM by Moviemaniac Good morning Bellies.....(well, it IS still in the AM here!)   I had no trouble logging onto the site last night.....I just didn't, because the jet lag B**ch caught me about 6:30 pm, and I crashed - Hard!  still not sleeping through night.....maybe tonight that will change. Yesterday I was missing the sushi so much, I bought a rice press and made my own for dinner.  DH was pleasantly surprised (I think he was afraid I would say I was too tired to cook-again).  Sushi turned out amazingly well, for a beginner!  I have lost a few pounds since leaving for Japan, not sure that it is a result of my eating (less) over there (except for TimTams, Traii!), or the incessant walking and stair climbing from the subway stops.  Am trying some different things in the gym right now......stairstepping for 12 mins. straight -that's a lot for me!  .....  followed by 40 minutes of elliptical set at a low height and a higher resistance......seemes to be working, I am exhausted right now! I really missed chatting with all of you during my time in Japan, and that is one of the positives of being back....but, I find myself with not too much to say today!  Except that I want your scone recipe, Liefie.....you are a bad influence-mentioning scones with cream and strawberries...reminds me of my Cornish grandmother...she used to make them for me all the time when I visited her.  (Pasties are another favorite of mine, thanks to her....my family thinks I'm demented!) I DID see some Hokkaido Brown bears when in Japan.....but they were behind bars.  HUGE animals....similar to Alaskan Kodiaks...I believe that the Browns in Canada and the US are a little smaller, but that would be small consolation if you were being chased by one! I have got to say...the rescue pigeon story is pretty funny.  Sorry it doesn't like John Denver! (Or does it?) I hope ALL are having a good day....sun is shining here, and the temp will hit 80* +  today...... Love and (((Hugs))) going out to all!  Namaste and God bless - Jackie PS:  Traii...I found a site that will sell TimTams here in the US, for giving them your firstborn.....just kidding, but almost double what I paid for them in Japan!!!!

Posts.Content: Apr 20, 2013 02:22PM Moviemaniac wrote: Hello to you beautiful Bellies....my FAVORITE place to be on these boards! I am making my 96 year old mother ( with Alzheimer's ) wait for a few whilst I post here..... Spoke to Nihahi on DIEP thread......but wanted to say here how relieved I was to hear from you.....I was getting worried, and I hope that as you read this you are starting to see some improvement to those issues......DIEP is a hard surgery.....I liken it to being run over by a semi-truck, which then backs up, and rolls over you again! Slight exaggeration, but......the good news is, you generally see small improvement every day..... Another way to look at it is like a hike.....mostly uphill, with a few flat spots and a little downhill on your way to your destination. Speaking of hikes...when I was having a particularly hard time during the first 3 weeks....I would imagine myself hiking to Iceberg Lake.....the visualization REALLY helped me get over those "speed bumps" on the road to recovery....(I am just a little further down that road than you, is all) You are in my thoughts every day! :-) Liefie, as you approach your surgery date, take a few minutes every day to work on your abs......it really, REALLY does help! I was pretty flat on top after nursing 4 babies, but had a lovely, custom-made for DIEP, spare tire in just the right location. :-) My new girls are bigger, AND much perkier than my originals. They took some getting used to! Very happy now! Traii, the general rule for DIEP recovery is 6 weeks, but some of the ladies on the DIEP board have gone back to work in 4 weeks. I had some complications, 7-8" of my abdominal sutures "blew out" b/c of infection. ( I was in surgery for 18 hours b/c one of my flaps failed due to restricted blood flow-I have tiny blood vessels-PS didn't want to lose it, so he opened me back up and fished around for another blood vessel in my abdomen to fix the problem. It was successful, but 18 hours is a LONG time to be opened up-you are asking for an infection like staph to settle in....) so......MY recovery was about 8 weeks, b/c I had to get re-sutured after the opened area healed up.....feeling great now, and my incision looks perfect....I think the PS did a little revising while in there sewing me back up. :-). Even with all the problems, I would do it again in a heart beat...... However, I am 58, and am not chasing after young children.....I may not have chosen this if I was. Keeping my fingers crossed that you get a date soon! Dakota, you busy, busy lady! And gorgeous, too! Can't believe you are so busy so soon after surgery! Be careful, okay? Reading about all you do makes ME tired! Websister, if you are considering DIEP, the wait may be worth it. I hope you are lucky and someone cancels their appt. and you get in sooner. It IS a big decision.....I feel lucky, I had a 2-2 1/2 month wait, it could have been 4, but someone cancelled, so I was able to take their spot. How is Mom? Settling in? Stressful caring for aging parents, isn't it? To be honest, I feel that a substantial amount of the depression I sometimes deal with has to do with that stress, and not my "illness". Oh well, won't last forever, will it? Take care. Edi.....you are one lucky lady! Can I squeeze in your suitcase along with Scottiee? I want to visit Scotland so much! Please send pics for me to enjoy vicariously, okay? And keep your house clean.....you NEVER know when I might show up on your front step! XO. Forgot to say how excited I am that you are making lovely cakes! Pics please! Hope the rads burn subsides.....does not sound fun. :-(. Besides, it cannot be allowed to interfere with your growing cake business! To all of you lovely, wonderful cyber-sisters......have a good day! (((Hugs))) Namaste and God bless -Jackie

Posts.Content: Mar 7, 2013 12:23AM Moviemaniac wrote: Liefie and Nihahi, will heed your advice and seek second opinion , but literature from Mayo clinic leans towards not treating with hormone therapy when conditions are like mine (stage 0 grade 1, with clean margins etc.) they state the survival rate really doesn't increase enough to warrant it. Right now my BC risk is about 1-2%, according to what my Onc said. Honestly, although I feel like I have been in a "fight or flight" mode for the past 5 1/2 months, I will be fine with calling it quits.....I don't think I could do hormone-blocking therapy as I am so osteoporotic and that stuff makes it worse.....QOL has to enter in somewhere! If taking the drug gave me at most another year overall, I would rather have one less year and no broken bones.....kind of a catch 22, I guess. I have all kinds of admiration and respect for you gals that have and do endure chemo. I know you don't do it for s***ts and giggles, but you DO it, with courage, and grace, and here I am whining about maybe having to take a stupid hormone-blocker......I guess deep down, I am basically a coward. I went back to the gym today, and am exhausted. Will check in tomorrow. G'night all! Namaste and God Bless-Jackie

Posts.Content: Mar 16, 2013 08:33PM Moviemaniac wrote: Hello everyone! ((Hugs))to all of you!  I wasn't planning on popping in this weekend, been trying to catch up on sleep, and other junk....but I was finally alllowed into the picture forum (a little late for my initial DIEP recon, but good for steps 2a and 2b.)  It took me over an hour to figure out what was in there-I am not very computer-savvy.   It's behaving just like March over here.....all blustery and WET!  SO ready for spring and especially summer-I expect to be hiking at least one day a week by then, recon be da**ed! Edi, you are SO funny!  Your posts have me laughing all the time.  I'm like Traii-I burst out laughing, and DH says: "what's so funny?"  I say: "it's a cancer thing-you wouldn't get it"  When I say that, he backs off....wonder why? I want to come to England and meet you!  Anyone with the name Edith is awesome, in my book!   Congratulations on 44 years!  I feel accomplished with only 36!  Looking forward to hitting that milestone.  I have a funny "Honeymoon Story"..... my wedding day started out actually the night before, when I got the pre-wedding jitters so badly that nothing could help me sleep, so I end up rolling into the church with ZERO sleep.  I was a mess, and I probably looked it!  Wedding was at noonish, with a combined family brunch after at a restaurant close by.  During this affair, DH's aunt is going table to table, trying to sell a gasoline additive for "better gas mileage".  My father looks at me and says" If she doesn't stop it right now, I'm going to throw her a** out"  Don't remember who put the Kybosh on it (maybe DH), but she stopped.  This "event" ended around four, and we had to prepare for a formal reception that evening, so I was running on fumes by then....somehow managed to get through a 3 hour ordeal (reception), and then DH and I had to drive 150 miles to our honeymoon destination (poor planning on our part, for sure).  By then, I was almost comatose, and DH was not much better, but somehow we managed to get ourselves there, without any mishaps.  We staggered up to our suite, where I decided that I had to have a much-needed soak in the tub, as my legs and feet were KILLING me!  DH said he would be waiting for me, and not to take too long ...I promised I would not.  I drew a lovely warm bath, and laid back in it, and promptly went to sleep......I awoke 5 hours later in a freezing cold tub of water (I am lucky I didn't drown-if the tub had been any larger, I may have!).  I staggered out of the bathroom, and found my hubby fast asleep and still in his tuxedo over the bottom corner of the bed.  He confessed to me later that he had not slept the night before, but didn't want me to know out of fear I would feel hurt!  I still  laugh whenever I think of that night.....silly kids we were!   Traii, my bed is also way high....I am terrified of falling off, and landing on my $$$$ reconned noobs.  Right now I am not very spry /limber and a fall from that height could spell disaster for my two adopted girls! I hope you are resting well, and that your SE are not causing too much misery. Websister, I hope you are taking it easy this weekend....your days make me very tired, and I haven't had rads OR chemo!  I do exactly what you do when DH takes off in the mall....I slow WAY down until he notices I am not next to him.  This usually happens 2-3 times (he's a slow learner) and then he finally slows down enough for me to stay with him. Nihahi, I am so sorry to hear about your childrens' struggles.  Watching your kids go through these health challenges is stressful, and heartbreaking.  #4 daughter  has been diagnosed with severe endometriosis AND ulcerative colitis. It so affects the overall quality of life for her, a great deal of the time. It's devastating for all of us. You are right about Iceberg Lake being prime Grizzly country, but so many people make the hike, that the bears usually stay down below in the upper meadow, or high above on the upper slopes above the trail.  I HAVE, however, been accosted by a very large male Moose, which came crashing through the trees and brush from below the trail, and  burst out on the trail 20 feet behind us.  Of course we were startled, (thinking it was a bear) and were reaching for our bear spray, when he burst through.....I don't know what we would have done if it HAD been a bear-we were all struck stupid when it happened!  :-/  The moose was annoyed we were there on HIS trail, and he was walking towards our small group to investigate.....we kept retreating up the trail, all of us trying not to think of things we know about moose: (how aggresive and dangerous they are, how you should never get too close-things like that), when he gave us one rather short charge, and then bolted up the hill, in the same direction he was headed when he *bumped* into us! Liefie, you are probably back to Vanc. Island by now....I hope you are still feeling the warm Carribean sunshine in your heart!  (And that you are completely relaxed and refreshed.)  Sorry that DH will need to return to his practice.....he probably needs to have a vacation from his vacation! Lovmy-LUV your opinion about the only perfect man...... short and to the point!  Where are pictures of your new kiddies?  I love goats, and would love to be able to have a few here, but we are not zones for anything other than chickens (NO roosters!). Dakota, if I lived on the East Coast, I'd buy lobster from your kids!  You are a good mom, and I know you'll find a way to get past the cockroach problem......as has already been said- you've been kicking breast cancer's a**! I hope you can get clarity on how to proceed from here. To the rest of you courageous, amazing ladies-have a lovely weekend, with few se's, and lots of rest! For you all (since it's St. Patrick's Day-at least it is here in the States)....Since my GGrandmother was Irish- May the road rise up to meet you,  May the wind be always at your back, May the sun shine warm on your face,  The rains fall soft upon your fields, And until we meet again May God hold you In the palm of His hand. Namaste and God Bless... Jackie
